meanings.definition: Produce or provide (a natural, agricultural, or industrial product)
meanings.sent1: The apple tree yielded a bountiful harvest this year.
meanings.sent2: The factory yielded a large quantity of goods for export.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome yielded a magical potion instead of vegetables.
meanings.sent4: Her hard work yielded a golden opportunity for success.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower yielded its seeds to the hungry birds.

meanings.definition: Give way to arguments, demands, or pressure
meanings.sent1: He yielded to his friend's request to borrow his bike.
meanings.sent2: The stubborn door finally yielded to the strong push.
meanings.sent3: The cat yielded to the temptation of the dangling toy.
meanings.sent4: The dam yielded to the force of the rushing water.
meanings.sent5: The old bridge yielded to the weight of the heavy truck.

meanings.definition: Surrender or submit to a superior force or to the authority or will of another
meanings.sent1: The defeated army yielded to the enemy's command.
meanings.sent2: She yielded to the teacher's instructions without protest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy yielded to the stern look of its owner.
meanings.sent4: The rebellious spirit finally yielded to the calming presence of nature.
meanings.sent5: The wild horse yielded to the gentle touch of the trainer.
